page.title: 16THE OLD MONASTERY
page.content: One of the most interesting and certainly the largest building in the area is the Old Monastery at Wood Barton, north of Woodleigh. In 1896 Trappist monks from France who were not able to worship as they wished came to The South Hams to start a new life. They built a very large structure, four storeys high, of stone and some brick. The chapel is constructed of corrugated iron, and has stained glass windows and carvings intact. The monks used the nearby 17th century farmhouse as a guesthouse, and on the south facing slopes they planted vines. After about 20 years the monks returned to France. Now the building is used by the farmer to store grain and machinery.
